3. Compensation: SS&C is do not provide good compensation as per market standard (e.g. for manager level start at 7 lakh pa). In the name of bonus gives nothing.

5. Management: Management talks lots of thinks but deliver very little.

headline: Bad Experience with the Company
pros: It is just like any other MNC.
cons:
Had one if the worst experiences of my life. The team had a history of employees switching because of toxic environment and bad managers. I found out within a month of joining why it was so. 
You are expected to know everything within a month of joining and in case you have doubts, they are not cleared saying that this was already taught to you! The way employees are treated completely shatters ones confidence and morale. There is no flexibility in working, in fact you are kept on a watch as to how much time you spend for taking breaks. 
The problem lies with the Managers and Directors who impose such a working culture in the team. This may not be the case in every department and team, but I was unfortunate to have encountered this one.

headline: Good Pay / Big fishes doing Scam / Bad Politics
pros:
1. Pay is better than Market
2. Good for learning new tech
3. Good for core domain experience
4. Overall good place for growth if you can adjust/deal with internal politics. Now days it is everywhere
cons:
1. Few big people with 20+ years stay rules everything.
2. Politics at its peak
3. Big fishes brings their friends/relatives who don't have any basic profile knowledge and they support them like hell. And then these new guys spoiling entire project. They are doing this for personal benefits rather than organization's.


Personal experience : worked 2 years, got promotion/hike and rest everything was good. Then one day new guys joins as a senior who don't know anything about technology stack. 

Guy entire profile was fraudulent
Not able to do basic work
But backed by one big fish
Business/techies was also not happy
Me and my senior resigned and now entire project is stucked since last 3 months. And that big fish still supporting him like his baby.

headline: Bad HR Team

- Autocratic leadership, promotion is favoured to few people whether you work hard or not you are promoted on the basis of your relationship with your director. 
- Politics is run to the core and people are taken advantage of
- You can work hard but that credit will be given to others so that they can be promoted. 
- Pathetic culture in the team
